posts.post_content:
The original [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath).
  
   
The prot black actually has some downside, e.g., [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead) doesn't work.
  
   
I'm not sure, but I think prot black was also a storyline element. I wish I remembered better...
  
   
Someone (Kaervek) summoned the Spirit of the Night and it wiped out an entire gathering of leaders, or something like that.
  
   
Anyway, this would totally be deserving of Mythic status. It sure goes **THUNK!** when it hits the table.
posts.html:
The original Akroma, Angel of Wrath.

The prot black actually has some downside, e.g., Animate Dead doesn't work.

I'm not sure, but I think prot black was also a storyline element. I wish I remembered better...

Someone (Kaervek) summoned the Spirit of the Night and it wiped out an entire gathering of leaders, or something like that.

Anyway, this would totally be deserving of Mythic status. It sure goes THUNK! when it hits the table.

posts.post_content:
Protection from Black, First Strike, and Haste make this better than [Demon of Death's Gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demon of Death's Gate), more than making up for the 3 power difference.  
  
Very few creatures have come along that overshadow the Spirit in the right deck. He remains on par with [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath) and [Sphinx of the Steel Wind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx of the Steel Wind).
posts.html:
Protection from Black, First Strike, and Haste make this better than Demon of Death's Gate, more than making up for the 3 power difference.

Very few creatures have come along that overshadow the Spirit in the right deck. He remains on par with Akroma, Angel of Wrath and Sphinx of the Steel Wind.

posts.post_content:
Blackroma!  
  
@kitsunewarlock: What pro-white? This is pro-black. Since black creatures are usually immune from black kill spells, its protection is actually a downside, to keep it from being [animate dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=animate dead)ed.

Blackroma!

@kitsunewarlock: What pro-white? This is pro-black. Since black creatures are usually immune from black kill spells, its protection is actually a downside, to keep it from being animate deaded.

posts.post_content:
An interesting card even today, no doubts there- and for a creature this old to still be even considered, is an impressive mark.   
  
However, I DO believe that [Withengar Unbound](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Withengar Unbound) just \*MAY have usurped Spirit of the Night's old pedestal as 'most frightening demon in Magic'. :p Especially if you consider Stoneforge Mystic.  
  
If you want the non-EDH version, try Stronghold Overseer. No, this has only one color of protection, and it's a color that arguably it doesn't even really need protection from-- I mean, black has the most kill spells, but a good handful of black kill spells already don't hurt black creatures.  
  
If it had protection from green and white, then it would still be up there with Akroma...alas, it does not. (pro-green IS relevant- green has anti-flying hate, and this is a flier!)
posts.html:
An interesting card even today, no doubts there- and for a creature this old to still be even considered, is an impressive mark.

However, I DO believe that Withengar Unbound just *MAY have usurped Spirit of the Night's old pedestal as 'most frightening demon in Magic'. :p Especially if you consider Stoneforge Mystic.

If you want the non-EDH version, try Stronghold Overseer. No, this has only one color of protection, and it's a color that arguably it doesn't even really need protection from-- I mean, black has the most kill spells, but a good handful of black kill spells already don't hurt black creatures.

If it had protection from green and white, then it would still be up there with Akroma...alas, it does not. (pro-green IS relevant- green has anti-flying hate, and this is a flier!)
